page.title: 16FISHING IN ORKNEY
page.content: It is said that Shetlanders are fishmen with ploughs and the Orcadians are farmers who fish.From their Norse ancestors the Orkneymen have good seamanship and they are known as first rate sailors . In the nineteenth century the{herring}industry grew up in Orkney.Insufficient capital made it difficult for Orcadian fishermen to get big enough boats.Most of the catch was taken by outsiders so the main local work was{gutting}and{salting. The fishing industry declined as the herring became scarce, and small fishing villages{lost population. The fishing industry has{revived}in the last 20 years, especially in Westray,Stronsay and Stromness. {Salmon, crab and lobster}are now contributing to the islands' economy, and freshwater{trout}helps to attract tourists.
